Package it.polimi.ingsw.network.client

Class Client

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.observer.Observable<CommunicationMessage>
it.polimi.ingsw.network.client.Client
public class Client extends Observable<CommunicationMessage>
Represents a Client.

  • Constructor Details

    • Client

      public Client(String ip, int port)
      Parameters:
      ip - the ip of the server on which the client is connected.

  • Method Details

    • close

      public void close()
      Close the client socket

    • isActive

      public boolean isActive()
      Returns whether the client is active or not.
      Returns:
      true if the client is still connected to the server and the connection is alive, otherwise false.
      See Also:
      • ClientConnectionStatusHandler

    • asyncReadFromSocket

      public Thread asyncReadFromSocket(ObjectInputStream socketIn)
      Given the input stream, create a thread that continuously waits for new messages while the connection is active; if the input is a CommunicationMessage, call the notify method with the message received (ClientMessageObserverHandler gets notified). If there isn't a server side response, kill the process.
      Parameters:
      socketIn - the input stream used for reading messages coming from the server.
      Returns:
      the thread used to read data while the connection is active.
      See Also:
      • CommunicationMessage
      • ClientMessageObserverHandler

    • asyncWriteToSocket

      public void asyncWriteToSocket(CommunicationMessage message)
      Create a thread that write the given message on the SocketOutputStream. When the message is written, flush and reset the socket.
      Parameters:
      message - message to write
      See Also:
      • CommunicationMessage

    • run

      public void run() throws IOException
      Effectively connects the client to the server, instantiate the Input and Output streams, creates the client's connection status handler for this client object/connection and then lets a thread wait incoming messages.
      Throws:
      IOException - when I/O errors occur.

    • setName

      public String setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the client, who in this case is a player who joined the server.
      Parameters:
      name - name of the player.
      Returns:
      player name set.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Returns the client nickname.
      Returns:
      the client nickname.

    • setIp

      public void setIp(String ip)
      Set the ip of the server on which the client connects.
      Parameters:
      ip - ip of the server on which the client connects.

    • setPort

      public void setPort(int port)
      Set the port of the server on which the client connects.
      Parameters:
      port - port of the server on which the client connects
